Push Notification Registration Cloud Service with SQL Storage

Introduction

The Push Notification Registration Cloud Service with SQL provides storage in a Windows Azure SQL Database or SQL Server database for the information of the registered devices with the service.

Prerequisites

  • Windows Azure SDK and Tools
  • NuGet 1.5 or above

Configuration

Configuring your connection string

  1. First of all, make sure to have a Windows Azure SQL Database database server available and configured.
  2. After that, you need to configure your connection string so it can be used by the service. To do this, go to the App_Start folder and open the NotificationServiceSql.cs file.
  3. In this file, replace the connection string used in the constructor of the SqlEndpointRepository class.
